Dialogue.Page: TRAPPIST-1f is the fifth planet around the star TRAPPIST-1.
TRAPPIST-1f is a terrestrial planet similar in size to Earth orbiting on the very edge of TRAPPIST-1's habitable zone.
It receives only around 40% of the light Earth does, although this is still warm enough for there to be liquid water on its surface, given the right atmosphere.
Newer studies suggest it has an oxygen atmosphere and is completely covered with oceans over a hundred kilometers deep.
Because of the liquid water it is a possible candidate for extraterrestrial life.
Older studies claimed that TRAPPIST-1f has a thick water vapor atmosphere, although a newer study suggests its atmosphere is composed of abiotic oxygen.
This atmosphere may be enough to warm the planet enough to allow liquid water on its surface.
TRAPPIST-1f is about 20% water by mass, many, many times all of Earth's oceans combined.
If the atmospheric conditions are right, much of that could be liquid.
Because of the low light lever, it may only be possible for liquid water to exist on the day side, with the night side always frozen.
Although movement of heat in the atmosphere may be enough to keep all the water liquid.
TRAPPIST-1f is a decent candidate for finding extraterrestrial life due to its liquid water.
However, the dim, reddish light may not be enough to sustain photosynthesis.
Maybe life could exist solely near the ocean floor, gathering energy from the heat created through tidal forces.
